attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LJz8DcEZnDxrJFkWCJD_description
attribs.current: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim Conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in Darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in Darkness, only shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LJz8NbueBG0wmv0Gqv9_description
attribs.current: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma Saving Throws against magic.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LJz8Z7lqQ-EYf-ZB6Ot_description
attribs.current: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to Magic Items, alchemical Objects, or technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LJz9QbzSCb8egyI2dzX_description
attribs.current:
ou have proficiency with artisan’s tools (tinker’s tools). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time. When you create a device, choose one of the following options:

Clockwork Toy: This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or Soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.

Fire Starter: The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a Candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.

Music Box: When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song’s end or when it is closed.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LJz9WguvnCnBS84IvVp_description
attribs.current: Though others must often endure extensive interviews and significant fees to gain access to even the most common archives in your library, you have free and easy access to the majority of the library, though it might also have repositories of lore that are too valuable, magical, or secret to permit anyone immediate access.You have a working knowledge of your cloister's personnel and bureaucracy, and you know how to navigate those connections with some ease. Additionally, you are likely to gain preferential treatment at other libraries across the Realms, as professional courtesy shown to a fellow scholar.

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current: I’m convinced that people are always trying to steal my secrets.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: No Limits. Nothing should fetter the infinite possibility inherent in all existence. (Chaotic)

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I have an ancient text that holds terrible secrets that must not fall into the wrong hands.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: Unlocking an ancient mystery is worth the price of a civilization. Paranoid.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LJzDne-wnX3jdJsm-c8_description
attribs.current:
At 1st level, you focus your craft on a particular specialization:
Cannonsmith, Gadgetsmith, Golemsmith, Infusionsmith,
Potionsmith, Warsmith or Wandsmith, each of which are
detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants
you features at 1st level and again at 3rd, 5th, and 14th level.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LJzEGvbQNk84ZkGj8np_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 1st level, your understanding of magic items allows
you to analyze and understand their secrets. You know the
artificer spells detect magic and identify, and you can cast
them as rituals.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LJzEpILMGX8CY42-L2A_spelldescription
attribs.current:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LJzFUb2PoWutOU9JoTt_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: (A pearl worth at least 100 gp and an owl feather)

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-LJzFUb2PoWutOU9JoTt_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You choose one object that you must touch throughout the casting of the spell. If it is a magic item or some other magic-imbued object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires attunement to use, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn which spell created it.
If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn what spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LJzGAWD6jMOb9qC38Se_description
attribs.current:
At 1st level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor and smith's
tools.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LJzGfiJ2ulmkf59Pn25_description
attribs.current:
At 1st level, when you take this specialization, you construct a
Mechplate Gauntlet. This is a specialized Wondrous Item that
only you can attune to. If you lose your mechplate gauntlet, you can remake it during
a long rest with 25 gold worth of materials, or can scavenge
for materials and forge it over two days of work (eight hours a
day) without the material expense.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LJzHgrkZEvBrsb-8MZ1_description
attribs.current:
Wondrous Item, Attunement (creator only).
Weight 5 lb.
While wearing this gauntlet, you have proficiency in Martial
Weapons, unarmed strikes using this gauntlet deal 1d6
bludgeoning damage, and you learn the Shocking Grasp cantrip
and can cast it through the gauntlet.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LJzIFCq4SYWBO9Ubfh-_spelldescription
attribs.current: Lightning springs from your hand to deliver a shock to a creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell Attack against the target. You have advantage on the Attack roll if the target is wearing armor made of metal. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 lightning damage, and it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-LJzIFCq4SYWBO9Ubfh-_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LNXqUpcGWljZIYdCmqu_itemcontent
attribs.current: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-LNXtaJXaiKDLjRd0cfT_itemcontent
attribs.current: A book might contain poetry, historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, diagrams and notes on gnomish contraptions, or just about anything else that can be represented using text or pictures. A book of spells is a spellbook.

attribs.name: character_appearance
attribs.current: Dark circles under his eyes, this gnome has a frazzled look. Across his face and body are scars that look like fern like figures, To well trained medical professional they'd know these are lighting scars. These scars spread across his lightly brown skin that are only tan colored due to melanin not sunlight.

attribs.name: character_backstory
attribs.current: Lichtenberg was a pretty run of the mill librarian. When he became 30 he decided to spend his adult life as a librarian. From that day he never set foot outside of the library of his hometown. After two hundred years had past he decided for a change of pace and made up his mind. He was going to go for a walk. Nothing crazy just a quick walk to the end of the road. He took a few steps outside and was struck by lighting, scarring him for life and forever changing him. The lighting not only fried his skin but also his brain. He became paranoid, and mentally unstable. Becoming obsessed with electricity deciding to harness the power that had disfigured him. Pouring over his books about thunder gods, and scrolls that had to due with what the adventures called "shock damage", he stumbled abound a book that had long ago found its way into the Archives. It was a book about a game called Dungeons and Dragons. It was in a language he couldn't read but picking out syntext he was able to sort of parse it out. He developed Truman Syndrome believing he was being manipulated by a DM's or a PC's whatever they were.Going mad with the revelation along with ihs brain already being fried he scrambled to find a way to stop these beings from controlling him. During his study he developed a theory about electric waves. He figured out that metal was able to interfere with these waves. This lead him to become an artificer with a specialization on armor. He figured if he was able to incase himself in a full suit of metal armor this would interfere in whatever DM's, or PC's trying to control him. His proudest achievement is his tin foil hat. Becoming desolate due to his crazed behavior the homeless started to call him sparky due to how his haphazard inventions would spark and crackle whenever one of his inventions failed.
